results.title: Riding your bicycle
results.brief_description: Outlines safe bicycle riding practices for the 7-12 age group. Firm safety rules are established and demonstrated, stressing the need for continual alertness, consideration for other road users and obedience to road rules and signs.

results.title: Riding the tiger
results.brief_description: Riding the Tiger is a series examining the history of Indonesia since the struggle for independence in 1945. The series focuses on the military organisation of Indonesian society and on the consequences of colonial rule on Indonesian politics and culture.

results.title: Riding on air
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information for Foreign Office and Colonial Office and Editorial Film Productions
results.brief_description: Britain’s bicycle manufacturing industry and the popularity of cycling in Britain. Forerunners of the modern bicycle; the manufacture of bicycles; and annual cross country cycle race and the International Cycle Rally. No other credits available.

results.title: Rideau Canal: reflections
results.brief_description: From its source in a narrow valley alongside the Parliament buildings in Ottawa, the Rideau Canal winds through the heart of the city and beyond, to its summit at Upper Rideau Lake. Following the Cataraqui River system, vessels descend at Kingston on the St Lawrence River. Peaceful communities that were established along the Rideau by the first travellers still reflect the lifestyles of the area’s original settlers. A hive of boating and camping activity in summer, a brilliant profusion of colour in spring and autumn, a 200km skating rink in winter, the Rideau Canal offers delights to historians, antique collectors, photographers, artists and sightseers.

results.title: Ride the wind
results.brief_description: Captures the essence of the sport of hang gliding. Shows experienced hang glider pilots soaring over beach ridges or flying high over rugged mountains. Cameras mounted on the wing during takeoff, flight and landing, involve the audience in the thrill of the sport.

results.title: Ride On
results.creator_credit: John La Pointe and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: A film on bicycle safety which begins with a comic history of the development of both the wheel and the bicycle. Six basic safety rules are stressed. Two points of difference beween Australia and Canada are that Australians ride on the left side of the road and the ‘yield’ sign is replaced by ‘give way’.

results.title: Rick Stein's seafood lovers guide
results.brief_description: Renowned chef Rick Stein takes a languid journey along the coastline of the United Kingdom in search of the best seafood places to eat and where to get the best produce when cooking fish yourself. Rick cooks an assortment of dishes using mackerel, Portland squid, dover sole, gurnard, herring, wolffish, haddock, mussels, smokies, Penclawdd oysters, monkfish, Mount’s Bay pilchards, abalone. He also calls in on the Blessing of the nets in Brighton, the Dieppe Street Market, Pilchard Press Works plus numerous other venues. Beautiful photography and delicious dishes make this a gastronomic as well as a armchair traveller’s delight.

results.title: Rick -File X258375
results.creator_credit: National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how the probation service responds to a youthful narcotics offender who - unbeknownst to the people coming into contact with him - is a probation employee himself. This film shows Rick assuming the role of ‘offender” and going through the same interview process as actual offender would go through.
